title: Aage se right
descriptions:
Aage Se Right (2009) is a Hindi comedy about two lost protagonists whose mix-ups set off a chain of chaotic, intersecting adventures in Mumbai. Dinkar Waghmare is a timid, rule-following traffic constable desperate to prove himself. One day he misplaces his service revolver, a mistake that could cost him his job and dignity. Determined to recover it, he embarks on a frantic citywide search, bluffing bravery he doesn’t possess and stumbling into situations that force him to confront his fears.

Meanwhile, Soniya Reddy, a spirited TV reporter hungry for a big break, chases a sensational story tied to a small-time gangster and a suspected terror plot. As Dinkar’s missing gun passes from one shady hand to another, it becomes the unlikely thread linking corrupt officials, quirky criminals, and media opportunists. The narrative hopscotches between Dinkar’s bumbling pursuit and Soniya’s aggressive investigation, with both inching toward the same explosive climax.

Along the way, Dinkar accidentally thwarts crimes, earns unexpected admirers, and discovers that courage often arrives after you’ve already leapt. The tone remains light and satirical, poking fun at red tape, sensationalist news, and swaggering machismo. When the dust settles, the gun is recovered, the real culprits are exposed, and Dinkar’s accidental heroism wins him the respect he craved, while Soniya lands her headline and a newfound regard for the earnest cop she once underestimated. The title, a colloquial phrase meaning “move forward/right ahead,” mirrors the film’s message: life only gets sorted when you stop fretting and keep moving forward.
